children.subject:
If this is the case then what about: 

https://piazza.com/class/hyq0br1u3kx7dg?cid=7388

Doesn't this mean the class can be expanded?
Oh yikes... I didn’t realize this was the case
fyi, I think 61C is being webcast? I emailed Prof. Garcia and he said it would be webcast

Webcasts have lots of benefits. For me, it means not having to drag my lazy butt to a lecture hall 2-3 times a week, instead getting to watch the lecture on my own time (especially helpful if I'd rather be doing something else at that particular time, e.g. napping or eating lunch). Not having to walk to every class saves me quite some time over a semester, and it gives me more flexibility scheduling my week. It's also very helpful if you zone out during lecture (which happens to everyone) and miss a key piece of information. You can also control the speed at which information is presented to you if the professor goes too fast or too slow. As long as you keep up with the webcasts (which I do), I think they're absolutely a benefit to student learning.

Plus, for students who do go to live lecture, it means less people to compete with for seats or the professor's attention :)

This is pure speculation, but I would be surprised if it isn’t at least partially motivated by abysmal lecture attendance in courses that webcast. Why people don’t attend lecture in person has never made sense to me, and I imagine that as an instructor it could be frustrating when no one shows up to class but then office hours/Piazza are slammed right before an assignment is due or an exam.

history.content: There is no department policy discouraging webcasting.  The decision to webcast (or not) is completely at the discretion of individual instructors.

I've noticed that courses like CS70, CS189, CS61C (potentially) and maybe some others won't be webcasting their lectures this semester. Is this the decision of the professors, or is it a slow rollout of some new department policy curbing webcasts? Webcasts have always been really helpful for me so it's sad that a lot of the large courses aren't offering them.
history.subject: Webcast Policy Changes
